Reviews.Title: “Great location and better than a two star!”
Reviews.Author: Sonny206
Reviews.Content: We found it hard to believe this hotel is a two star. The location was fab. i recommend getting a train and then metro if coming from cdg airport as it is around 7 euros each as apposed to taxi. The rooms were badic but very clean abd a good size. only bath towel provided so you may want to take your own small face towel. Breakfast was only orange juice, tea or coffee and a basket of croissants rolls and jams but set us up for the day! Croissants were nice! The lift is small and two persons got stuck in there one evening so we stopped using it after that! Supermarket and metro stop jus round the corner plus a mcdonalds kfc and other restaurants walking distance. Friendly staff and enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “le meurice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jasper1958
Reviews.Content: we spent 2 nights at this first class hotel in Paris and whilst the stay was ok, it wasn't the RitzIf you intend to stay there ,please DONT have breakfast in the Dali restaurant. This was a major disappointment and if you are paying £53 per person, you expect better. The service was dire and even though we were the only ones in , we had to keep asking for things such as refills of coffee, a side plate!!, and cutlery. Not what you expect. The main dining room ,which we couldn't get into on our first morning, was the complete opposite. BEWARE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Dlanor82
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, although with a two star rating it is more a 3+ stars for the overall experience. Metro station only a few steps away. Many good restaurants in the area. Only negative thing was the elevator, which only a luggage and yourself can fit in it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: meganmckean
Reviews.Content: We stayed a the Paris France Hotel for 7 nights in February. We had booked it very last minute, and had found it difficult to find a hotel at this time as it bumped into the Valentines Day holiday. We booked Paris France Hotel online and arrived a few days later. The staff were very friendly and helpful, we were greeted by a lovely man who gave us a map of Paris, directions for nearby amenities and other things related to our stay. We had booked a superior room, and were not disappointed. Plenty of space and views of the Eiffel Tower - it was a perfect welcome to Paris. The location is great, a fairly short walk to the Louvre and plenty of restaurants nearby. It is also located to 2 main metro stations, as well as a large supermarket, which was helpful for grabbing something quick and easy on the way home at night. Prices were not cheap, but definitely worth what we paid. The breakfast that can be included (for an extra cost) is a croissant and bread roll with condiments, and coffee/tea/hot chocolate. We were glad we had included the breakfast, as it was always a good start to the day. A really teeny-tiny elevator made getting upstairs a little difficult with our luggage, and we only had 2 bags. Perhaps if you're travelling with more luggage a room on a lower floor would be advised. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and well located”
Reviews.Author: Which_way_now
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel due to trip advisor reviews and convenient location. Staff were welcoming, helpful and spoke and understood english well. The triple room for 3 adults was excellent value EUR147.00 per night. The room by european standards was a good size, with comfortable beds, well heated, good sized bathroom with good shower pressure (over bath) and clean. There were no tea coffee making facilities however there was a guests lounge on the ground floor which although we did not use looked to offer coffee/tea, lounge chairs and a computer. Hotel staff were happy to hold our luggage on day of checkout so we could wander the streets without taking our suitcases. We walked all around the city from this location - a taxi fare from Notre Dame via the hotel to collect our bags and then on to airport was approx EUR57.00. Would recommend this hotel without hesitation. Rue Turbigo is a reasonably busy street and not as quaint as some but the hotel is surrounded by good cafes and it's not far to walk to nearby charming cobbled streets.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: scorer14
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights during February to celebrate a birthday. I would stay here again when next in Paris because the service is good, our room was large, clean and hygienic and also very comfortable for a city centre hotel. The location near two sub stations is also convenient and we found a plentiful choice of good restaurants all within a few blocks of the hotel itself. I would recommend to friends and colleagues.

Reviews.Title: “little gem”
Reviews.Author: Stadjer
Reviews.Content: I really loved this hotel, the staff is very friendly and speaks English. I could choose from two rooms, one single on the top floor overviewing Paris and the Eiffel Tower or a larger and warmer room. Since I stayed in February the choise was easily made. You could hear some traffic noise when closing the windows, but that is all. The matrass was good however quite hard, but this is of course my opinion. The bathroom is vey clean, Breakfast is in the basement of the hotel, it was more than enough for me. The hotel is at walking distance from metrostation Place de la RÃ©publique where some major lines run. Nearby is metrostation Temple with gorgious art-nouveau decoration. I would highly recommend this hotel, stayed only for two nights but I will return again.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy and well maintained”
Reviews.Author: ddexter
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a number of times and have found it to be well located and good value for money. Most of the rooms have been redecorated and have a pleasant contemporary feel to them. The bathrooms are a reasonable size and have a good standard of fitting. The last time I was here I advised them that I was flying in early and I was very pleased to find that my room was ready when arrived after a very long flight. There is a small lift which means you don't have to carry luggage upstairs. There is also free wifi in the rooms. The area is convenient, with 2 metro stations and lots of options for eating nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good night's sleep, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: cwight55
Reviews.Content: A clean and comfortable hotel, just 3 metro stops from Gare du Nord, this traditional building is in a good location and easy to find. Only 10 min walk, from the Marais with its cafes, restaurants and museums. The lift, which can only accommodate 2 very good friends at a time, is a tourist attraction in itself! If you get a room on the top floor (e.g no. 84) it is very quiet at night and you can see as far as the Sacre Coeur. Very helpful and efficient staff. Free WiFi and modern and responsive heating. Will definitely visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful long stay in Paris !!!”
Reviews.Author: Gary T
Reviews.Content: This past January , I spent 16 days at the Paris France Hotel ........ The staff could not have been more wonderful and helpful !!!!!!!!! January can be rainy and grey in Paris, but my stay was cheery and fun because of the manager Maurice( and Ari ) and Christelle, Herve, Joe and all the staff at the Hotel .......I would recommend this hotel to all my freinds who want a great location, terrific transportation, clean and nice rooms with ample bathrooms in Paris.... The neighborhood has so many wonderful and helpful things within walking distance to the hotel.....I will always consider staying at this hotel when I go to Paris ( which is often ) ... Excellent is not a good enough rating for the Hotel Paris France !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “terrific!”
Reviews.Author: Netski66
Reviews.Content: We found it to be a really nice, affordable hotel in a great location near a few metros and bicycle depots as well as walking distance from a ton of cool cafes. All of the major sights are easy enoughto get to from here. The staff are friendly and excellent (especially Herve), both before arrival (by email) and in person. The room was a decent size, stylish and renovated, with 2 windows overlooking a lovely church and letting the sun in. The bathroom was very modern. It was super clean and peaceful, with a lift and a free computer/internet/printer service in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “I join the previous reviews”
Reviews.Author: Flitzmaus
Reviews.Content: as I arrived early I was given the keys of 2 rooms on different floors and I could make my choice... I opted for the red single on the 4th floor... spotlessly clean, and 2 windows... As it was a stormy day I felt a bit chilly due to some draft from the window next to the bed; after pushing the bed to the wall, that matter was solved. Staff very friendly and helpful... Unfortunately the elevator broke down and couldn't be repaired during my stay... All hotel guests were offered free breakfast for the inconvenience caused... so not only did I not pay for my breakfast, but I could exercise the calories immediately off... A bit of a nuisance was the noise created by all the stair walkers at all hours of day and night... ear plugs came handy. The hotel is very conveniently located and is affordable... would go there again...

Reviews.Title: “Location was great.”
Reviews.Author: gumell
Reviews.Content: Colese to all the atrractions and the hotel staff were excellent giving great advice on things to do and see. The breakfast was good although some more hot dishes could be added. I have nothing but goof things to say about this hotel and would recommend to others travelling to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Paris visit”
Reviews.Author: renibb
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed her for 4 nights. Location excellent, easy access. The room was a good size, clean and very comfortable. The front desk service was cordial and give us really good advice for restaurants in the area. Our favorite was "Au fil des Saisons" excellent food and services.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, friendly and conveniently located small hotel”
Reviews.Author: dianeguide
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights just before Christmas and will definltely make this our "home from home" when we return to Paris. The location is great with two subways (Temple and Republique, the latter which is on a direct line from the Gare Du Nord), a good choice of eating places and convenient shops for food, toiletries etc nearby. If you like culture and interesting small shops this is on the edge of the Marais Disctrict with high quality shopping and fascinating small museums. Our room was small but comfortable and spotlessly clean Tthe staff were friendly and helpful. Only drawback was lack of tea/coffee making facilities in the room but this might not be the norm in Paris. Also, my partner didn't like the taste of the coffee served at breakfast (my herbal tea was fine!) However these are minor niggles and I can't say that these things spoiled our stay. We will recommend the Paris France to any friends who are considering a trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent clean small hotel in central Paris”
Reviews.Author: Brian_SEA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Paris France Hotel for 6 nights during my 40th birthday in mid-November 2011. I booked a single room with a request for a balcony room...and I got one! The tiny elevator whisked me to my room and I opened up the windows for beautiful Haussmann architecture all around. When I closed the balcony doors, the room was very quiet. The room was clean and the cleaning staff replaced my towels and replenished soap each day. The location couldn't be better. I could walk about 12 blocks down to the clubs in Marais and not worry about taking the Metro back after hours (since it shuts down shortly after midnight or so). And, during the day, of course, the Metro couldn't be closer. The hotel is 1/2 block from the Temple Metro station and about 2 1/2 blocks from the much busier Republique Metro station (I believe at least 3 lines stopped at Republique). The Monoprix across the street (behind the hotel) was very convenient for snacks, pastries, soda, and what-not items. I never ate breakfast at the hotel since I would usually walk down to the Marais area. There is a church right next door with romantic bells that chime at the hour and 15-mins increments (but not overnight nor in early morning..thankfully). I highly recommend this hotel for any travelers to Paris - especially single travelers who don't want to cough up tons of euros for a tiny room (and therefore can spend the savings on great food and wine...which is why you go to Paris, anyway). :-)

Reviews.Title: “My favourite small hotel in Paris - J'adore Hotel Paris France !”
Reviews.Author: DionneLoehr
Reviews.Content: I first came across Hotel Paris France 4 years ago when I planned my first visit to Paris from Australia for 4 weeks. I had planned to stay in an alternative hotel for part of my trip, but I was so impressed with this place that I stayed the whole time! They also booked a room for a friend who visited for a weekend and were exceedingly helpful. I have since stayed at this charming and conveniently located hotel for 3 other visits,both on my own and with a partner, and I've recommended countless friends who have also loved the hotel. For a 2 star establishment, this hotel exceeds all other experiences I have had. The staff, in particular the lovely Christelle and Herve are so polite and helpful, and have helped me with my poor French and sense of direction arrange everything from a day at Versailles, shopping the Grand Magasins to getting to the flea markets and booking airport shuttles. The location is great - right near the charming Marais- full of cafes, bars and shopping and an easy stroll past Hotel De Ville and along the Seine into the city centre. I prefer staying here close to Republique as the metro is right outside and it's just so convenient and easy to navigate. There is a Monoprix located right behind the hotel and a few charmante eateries (L'absinthe Cafe, the quirky Cafe Temple and La Favorite for a quick kir ) right near the hotel. It doesn't have the touristy feel that other places closer to the City Centre have had, and the other 2 star hotels I have tried that have actually been more expensive have been so disappointing in comparison to Hotel Paris France. The rooms are on the smaller side but are roomy by Paris standards ! Each room I've stayed in has been light, airy and clean - the last time I stayed the hotel had been completely refreshed and renovated so it was even better ! The wonderful staff have always given me a great deal on my booking and room. The views across Rue Turbigo are best seen from the upper floors, you can even see a hint of the Eiffel Tower from one of the attic rooms that I've stayed in previously, and the views from the bathroom window of the glorious old church next door are lovely. There is a charming petite lift, however I prefer taking the stairs to burn off the Parisian pastries and macarons and the downstairs foyer is beautifully appointed with original decorative tiled floors, sandstone walls and chandeliers. I like the simple decor of the rooms - clean crisp linen and no daggy artwork on the walls !!! It really is a great find for affordable accomodation in Paris and I look forward to my next stay in a year or so. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel for anyone planning a stay in Paris - such great value for money , a lovely ambience and great location (plus all those extra euros saved can be put to great use along the Rue St Honore !!)

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel find”
Reviews.Author: morsemoose
Reviews.Content: This small hotel has wonderful staff always so nice and willing to help. It was very convenient that they had a computer with internet for guest use in the lobby. The elevator like most in older buildings was very small and would hold 2 people and their luggage, maybe. But it always worked. The room although small was comfortable and clean. everything work as it should. The breakfast is rather typical with coffee/tea and crossant with a hard roll butter and jam. The location was good, close to restaurants and the Metro. And it was only about a 15 minute walk to Notre Dame. Very convenient and a pretty good price for Paris. Would stay here again in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “Villa St. Martin”
Reviews.Author: Leeann327
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a wonderful place to stay in Paris. The hotel staff went above & beyond to be very helpful. The rooms were bigger than previous places I've stayed in Paris. It is only a 5 minute walk to Gare de L'Est Metro Station. Wonderful restaurant w/in 1 minute walk on same street (rue des re'collects). Also w/in 5 minute walk great Italian Restaurant 0039 on Rue Faubourg. Hotel extremely quiet and very well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem in Central Paris”
Reviews.Author: Ciuliano
Reviews.Content: We have used this little hotel for many years for our groups. We have always found the staff to be extremely cordial and understanding. Rooms are clean and the building was recently refurbished. We will continue to use this hotel that offers a cosy retreat in the heart of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Our Second Stay, Just as Nice as The First”
Reviews.Author: LoveEurope411
Reviews.Content: Second time staying at the Hotel Paris and I can honestly say that we love this Hotel. It's convenient to the Metro, city buses, train stations, and the sights around the Seine. The staff is always friendly, the rates are reasonable,and the rooms are not only clean, but air conditioned! I don't believe that you can find a better hotel for the price anywhere in Paris. I always book online through the hotel website. Plenty of local cafes and grocery stores within a block! There's also a self service laundry a few blocks away. From the entrance of the hotel go across the street down Rue Vertbois two blocks, turn left onto Ru Montgolfier, the laundry is the blue front building. I've used it several times and they also have drop off service. If you're like me you speak very little or no French here's a website that explains in English how to use the machines.http://www.francetravelplanner.com/go/paris/shop/laundromat_use.html

Reviews.Title: “great hotel with beautiful walk straight down to l'hotel du ville”
Reviews.Author: looby674
Reviews.Content: lovely hotel , very clean , they were refurbing the dining room while we were there so we ate out for breakfast which was expensive and not very child friendly where we were but luckily fresh croissants were available just across the rd so they held us until later . The hotel is a typical old French building absolutely beautiful with a winding staircase and the worlds smallest elevator in the middle . The kids loved it !Staff were very helpful and friendly and even managed to politely interpret my rusty schoolgirl French . the metro station was about a 5 minute walk away so transfers to gare du nord were accomplished easily although we did miss the rd first time around and had to walk all the way around the place de la republique ......and stop and eat at a creperie ....before we found the rue de turbigo !!highly recommend this hotel very reasonably priced and not too far from central Paris that the kids had trouble walking in

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good and I'd recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: Big C
Reviews.Content: I've only been to Paris a few times but it seems you don't get there what you get here unless you pay mega money! Our room was pretty basic. It had the usual, bed, TV etc. The bath was a bit odd, about 3/4s the size of a 'normal' one, but OK. As with a lot of these places there was no tea/coffee faciltiy in the room but actually this worked to our advantage because it got us out into the city really early. The location is fab there was plenty of nice places to have breakfast and close to the Metro so easy to get about. The staff were really friendly and spoke English, the best thing is a lady working there didn't wet herself when I tried speaking to her in French! All in all a great place to stay if you want to get out and about and view Paris, and why wouldn't you!

Reviews.Title: “Great accomodation!”
Reviews.Author: harrykeith
Reviews.Content: I have been staying for many times at this hotel. The staff make you feel at home offering any help and info needed. Super clean rooms and great central location.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Paris France is small and effective for serious tourists.”
Reviews.Author: DougParke
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights. Room was small, bed was great. View from window was typical Parisian streetscape. Window insulation was excellent which is important as Parisians go out until late. Walls were thin but tv. Plume limited by hotel so good in that respect. Staff were orally helpful and made the stay. Have no hesitation in recommending if you are on a budget and focused on absorbing Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Karen C
Reviews.Content: Great Location!! The room was clean and not as small as I thought it was going to be. Very friendly and helpful staff. Would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive and convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: Pippa13
Reviews.Content: Good location, about two blocks from Temple metro stop and the L'Open Paris bus stop which takes you literally everywhere in Paris; very clean rooms/linens, elevator, helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “This is an inexpensive gem in the Marais”
Reviews.Author: TWAjunkie
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel cheap and delightful, in a great location with a dedicated and helpful staff. The room was very large by Paris standards, facing a gorgeous building across the street. It had been redone in contemporary green tones, the beds were terrific, and the bathroom perfect. I stayed here with a handicapped friend who uses a wheelchair. The staff stored the wheelchair behind the front desk, and saw to her every need, for which I was very grateful. I'd stay here again in a minute!

Reviews.Title: “I keep coming back”
Reviews.Author: Emma13a
Reviews.Content: The rooms are funny shapes, a little small and the bathrooms are not made for a glamour puss BUT the rooms are nicely decorated and spotless. The staff will bend over backwards to help and always will stop to have a laugh. There are supermarkets within walking distance things you have forgotten - toothpaste and socks. Again within walking distance are loads of excellent cafes and restaurants. Best thing is Les Marche des Enfants Rouge if you like food on Rue de Bretagne - the small historic food market. I have used this hotel as a pit stop for me in Paris nearly half a dozen times. The only thing to make it excellent would be a little more panache in the bathroom. I'd rather be out and about though than checking out a bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Real Gem”
Reviews.Author: Louise A
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights. Very close to Temple and Republique metro. 10 minute walk to Notre Dame and Les Halles. Will come back again and recommend to others to stay

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the solo traveller”
Reviews.Author: Cherryredpinup
Reviews.Content: I see a lot of reviews of Parisian hotels that complain that the rooms are small. FYI in Paris all rooms are small, unless you're paying $$$$$$! My single room at Hotel Paris France was small but not much smaller than a double room I've stayed in before in another hotel. The bathroom was actually bigger. More importantly it was clean, tastefully decorated and with THREE large windows offering various typical Paris street views. The staff were all very friendly and helpful (and also spoke English if you're French isn't tres bien). Great location too - close enough to lots of must-see attractions, either walking or via the Metro, but far enough away from the tourist thronged areas. No scam artistes or tat peddlers and safe enough to walk about by oneself in the evening. Next time I visit Paris I'll be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Overall, a lovely little hotel, shame the walls are so thin!”
Reviews.Author: Kat01new
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paris France Hotel for 3 nights in August 2011. The hotel is situated very close to the Temple metro stop and a couple of minutes walk from the Republique metro stop. We stayed in a triple room on the sixth floor, facing onto the main road outside the hotel. The traffic noise was loud with the balcony doors open, but when shut, the doors kept out the noise well. There was air conditioning in the room. The room was clean, as was the bathroom. The bathroom was slightly on the small side, but did the job - only issue was with the hairdryer which kept overheating and cutting out. The room was cleaned daily and the towels replaced. Bedlinen was clean and the bed was comfy. However, the one big downside with the hotel, for me, was that the walls between the rooms are super thin - you can hear talking and television very clearly in the adjoining rooms and I am sure I heard someone on the floor above using the toilet! This did cause me a problem as I am a very light sleeper. The breakfast is basic but OK - small crusty roll, croissant, butter, honey and jam, juice and coffee or hot chocolate. You can take a breakfast tray to your room if you want. All of the staff we spoke to were pleasant and helpful. We were able to leave our bags after checkout on the last day. The lift is very small and you can just squeeze in 2 people with bags. The hotel is about a 20-25 minute walk from Notre Dame and we found it easy to get around Paris either on foot or on the metro. There are some nice places to eat within a 15-20 minute walk from the hotel and there are several little supermarkets nearby. We booked online, via the hotel's website and thought the rates were reasonable for the standard of the hotel. I would like to say I would stay in the hotel again, but unfortunately the thin walls between the rooms would put me off. It's a shame really, as otherwise the hotel is lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with everything one needs”
Reviews.Author: LuHH
Reviews.Content: This was our second time in Paris, and we wanted a hotel with good location. We had been there a year before and stayed in a hotel which was a lot further away, for 10 euros more than we paid this time, and we decided to book Paris France HÃ´tel based on the reviews we read at Trip Advisor which said it was conveniently located. I must say we were really pleased with what we found! It is a two-star hotel which could easily have two more stars for its cozy, clean and charming atmosphere. We booked a superior double room for 5 nights for 115 euros, as there were no more standard rooms available, but had the chance to take a glance at their standand rooms which were a bit smaller, but just as good. The room was spacious, with a comfortable double bed with clean bed linen, comfortable pillows and duvets, an extra single bed, plenty of space for luggage and for moving around, a two-door wardrobe, a desk with a chair, bedside tables, an LCD TV set with cable TV with some channels in English and free wifi. There was no safe or minibar in the room, but we always kept our luggage locked with our laptop and personal belongings in them and had no problems at all. The bathroom was not really modern, but it was spotlessly clean, bright and spacious, the only drawback being the fact that it did not have a shower, but a bath and a hand douche which did not hang from the wall (and here is my suggestion to the hotel manager, please find a way to hang the douche from the wall!). The rooms were cleaned every day, and the staff were pleasant, polite and willing to provide whatever information and help we needed. We only had breakfast there once, which we wouldn't have again, except for the convenience of not having to leave the hotel on the very day we departed, but there are two really nice "brasseries" and a supermarket close to the hotel. The Temple underground station is right outside of the hotel if you want to spare your feet to the parks and boulevards of Paris, but it is within walking distance to Centre Pompidou, HÃ´tel De Ville, the Notre Dame, the Louvre and many other touristic sites. It is also one block from RÃ©publique, where there are about a dozen nice restaurantes and cafÃ©s. Our room was on the 5th floor, with a view to a side alley with a beautiful church, Ã‰glise Sainte-Ã‰lisabeth, and although Rue de Turbigo is a quite busy street we were never disturbed by noise. Ok, the elevator is really tiny, and there's only space for two people, or one person plus luggage, but it is quite charming anyway. We do recommend Paris France HÃ´tel, and will definitely stay there again on our next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Botique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: coconut_wireless
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from spending nine nights in Paris at 'The New Orient Hotel'. This lovely hotel is all of the nice things other "trippers" have posted about it previously. The rooms are the traditional size for European Boutique Hotels; small but once settled in quite adequate. They are fresh & tastefully decorated and the daily maid service keeps them immaculate . A must for dinner is the nearbye restaurant Au Bois d/Acacia 17 Rue de Constantinople Each morning as you driftÂ  lazily in and out of sleep your subconscious is aroused by theÂ  aroma of freshly baked croissants and pastries for the petit Â  dejuneau.Â  Breakfast is not included in the room rate and albeit a bit expensive (we were on theUS $) it is convenient and the dining room has a lovely ambiance. If you decide not eat at the hotel you have the option of going to one of the near by patisseries.Â  The beds and the pillows (extra pillows are given)Â  are very comfortable. There is a writing desk that conveniently doubles as a dressing table to put on makeup etc. BUT I would highly recommend the hotel puts in better lighting to make this area more functional for both writing and putting on make up. A tiny fridge would have been nice to keep cold drinks. The neighborhood is convenientlyÂ  located between two metro stations ; Villers & Europa and is in a quite residential neighborhood. The self service laundromat and the minimart across the street was a real plus for us. A few blocks up from the hotel and a short walk across the boulevard past the Villers Metro station is a neighborhood shopping street. On Sunday there is street market. Madame Catherine is delightful and graciously attends to your every need. She and her handsome husband Joseph are French hospitality at it's best. My husband and I parted feeling like old friends I would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay there again. In all fairness IÂ  would not recommend this hotel for families with young children under the age 12 or handicapped folks because of the stairs. There is a lift but it opens up onto stairs that could be dangerous for younger children and handicapped individuals. With those few exceptions you wouldn'tÂ  find a nicer, friendlier owner run hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean and quiet accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Riflerangeblues
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here for a long weekend with family and the hotel was great. Rooms were large, clean and comfortable. Bathrooms were a tad on the small size, but serviceable (and to be fair we didn't spend that much time in the room - who does in Paris?). The hotel is on a pretty busy road, but the glazing provided an almost silent room - lovely. The staff were excellent, very friendly and welcoming. There was significant upgrading work going on in the hotel, but we hardly noticed it - so full marks to the staff for the way in which this was managed. The location is a very easy walk from the Gare du Nord for those arriving on Eurostar, the Temple metro station is about 10 seconds walk away, or it's a 15 minute walk to the Hotel de Ville. So all good. Recommended as a good value base.

Reviews.Title: “This is the best bang for your euro”
Reviews.Author: hernher
Reviews.Content: This hotel is Ideally located in the center of the city ,between the Marais and Beaubourg center area, If you are a decent walker you will barely need to get on the Metro. I was travelling on my own and I paid 80 euro a night. I had a single room (bed) but it was on the top floor with a wrap around balcony with the church steeple right beside me, It was lovely. The staff at the hotel are most welcoming. It was very hot in Paris when I was there and the room had A/C which was wonderful. I highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay there again,

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: gbbird
Reviews.Content: The location is close to Republique Metro, which gets you to more places than the Temple line, which is a little closer. The room was comfortable and it was possible to control the a/c in the room. Although the room was small, there was a comfortable chair, closet and large bathroom with tub. The beds were comfortable. Because we knew the elevator was small we requested a room on the 1st floor (2nd American). That made it easier to walk down from the room. One of the best features is the convenice of a Monoprix department store on the street behind the hotel. You can walk through the alley next to the church next door. We were on the church side of the hotel and could see it from the window and hear the church bells, which didn't bother us. The only negative we have is that one of the desk clerks was unfriendly and refused to let us borrow a corkscrew, suggesting that we bring the wine bottle to the kitchen. We later bought one for the rest of the trip and it miraculously made it through airport security several times.

Reviews.Title: “Great, simple accommodation.”
Reviews.Author: Mon100
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed for 4 nights at the end of May. We're both the type of people that don't spend much time at the accommodation other than a place to store our suitcases, sleep and eat breakfast. In saying that we look at accommodation that is clean, safe, good location and has helpful staff. The room was small but adequate. The staff were helpful with any questions we had. The breakfast was simple, I've had slightly better at other places hotels but its enough for a basic breakfast. Overall its a lovely little hotel, close to several Metro stations and comfortable rooms. I would probably stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good for value”
Reviews.Author: lovethesun920
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 4 nights at the beginning of June. I'm an avid trip advisor reader, so chose this hotel after looking at MANY hotels. I think that for the money we spent, the hotel was great. Here are a few key points *Reception - staff was friendly. They answered all of our questions, helped make us a reservation at a restaurant, recommended river boat tours when we asked. *Fairly clean - there seemed to be some mildew in the bathroom shower, but beyond that, we thought the room was very clean *Small - we had a standard room and it was definitely on the smaller side, but when you pay 95 euros a night, I don't think you could've found a better value *Now, having spent time in Paris, I would've rather have been in a more "busy" (touristy?) neighborhood - closer to Opera or Grand Boulevards. There seemed to be more just outside those stops than near this hotel - which was off the beaten path. Depends what you are looking for. *Location was, however, near 2 metro stops so that part was at least convenient. *Beds - were just okay, not super comfortable, but not super uncomfortable either. *Weather was on the cooler side while we were there, so we didn't have any issues with the air conditioning *They appear to be renovating the 7th floor??? When we left at 11am for the airport, we heard TONS of pounding/sound from the roof. Annoying for that morning, but hadn't noticed earlier in the trip because we were always out and about much earlier than that. To sum up, for the amount of time spent in the room, a 2 star hotel like this one is adequate. I wouldn't have wanted to pay more money, but would consider looking for a hotel a little closer to the action next time.

Reviews.Title: “you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: fusspot_11
Reviews.Content: My civil partner and I stayed here for one night during a warm night in June. The hotel is very central in the northern Marais with plenty of cafes, bars and restaurants and Metro stops very close by. Temple is the nearest stop but Republique is only a few minutes walk, so don't bother changing lines if it's more convenient. There is a big Monoprix (supermarket) two minutes from the hotel. Staff are friendly and helpful and a few words of basic French helps with this. We had, for central Paris, a very spacious sixth floor room (66), basic but clean and tidy. Beds a bit soft for our taste and a quite eccentric light switch system. It was a sultry night and the air conditioning was very effective. Big double glazed windows which open wide in both the room and the bathroom which meant the room is quiet but with a low rumble of traffic during the day - this is central Paris! Great views over Parisian rooftops with glimpses of the Eiffel Tower in the distance and a huge crumbling church next door. You probably wouldn't want to spend a lot of time in the room but if you do, then maybe review what you're doing in Paris. Definitely good enough for an afternoon or pre dinner nap and a good base for business or pleasure. Even has a desk for a laptop (didn't have chance to test the wifi) and a couple of chairs. Bathroom basic, clean with a decent shower and full size bath, plenty of hot water and lots of room. Couple of tiny tablets of soap so bring your own if you're staying for a longer time. Breakfast is basic at 6 Euro - croissant, bread roll, butter, jam and honey. Orange juice and coffee were standard and acceptable. Plenty of alternatives at cafes nearby but we didn't have time to try them. The Paris France is a good example of a basic ** Parisian hotel. The decor is not to everyone's taste. It's generally a bit scuffed and chipped in places but it has a good feeling of being clean and tidy. Some reviewers seem obsessed with carpet stains but one persons 'stain' can be another's 'wear and tear' or just a 'mark'. The lift is a hoot - a triumph of French engineering! Would definitely use it again and recommend it as a very central, no frills place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Nice Hotel And We Are Going Back To Stay Again In July 2011”
Reviews.Author: LoveEurope411
Reviews.Content: Friendly, helpful staff, clean room. We had great views from the 7th floor! Very near to three Metro stations and on the bus lines.We highly recommend getting a Paris Metro pass its the easiest and least expensive way to travel in and around the city. Gare du Nord and Gare de l'Est train stations are both located just a couple of blocks away. Also, the hotel is about a twenty minute walk to the river. Very reasonably priced for an air conditioned room in Paris. We did'nt use the hotel restaurant instead we used the numerous cafes,bakeries, and stores on the streets around the hotel. Also, there is a coin laundry located just a block away that can in very handy after two weeks in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Great little budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Leigh1982
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in Paris France Hotel. It is a good little budget hotel. The rooms are on the smaller side, but that is to be expected in Paris for 95 euro a night. Totally adequate for two people. Staff friendly and helpful. Very comfortable bed. Room very clean and towels changed daily. Only complaints would be no bar fridge in room and no shower curtain. But these are not a huge deal considering price. Location is walking distance to several tube stops and the louvre. Would stay again if on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Yuki2703
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very good and clean. The room and bathroom were tiny, but adequate for my husband and I for our honeymoon. The bed was also small. They do have a lift but again tiny, only one person with a bag can fit. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The location was great, close to the Republique train station and the Temple station. If you kept the window open at night it was very noisy, but if closed it was OK. Free internet available in your room which was great for us. No breakfast included however. I have stayed here before, so I would stay here a third time.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable”
Reviews.Author: Insatiable Nomad
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paris, France hotel for a week in early May. On the plus side, the rooms are very clean and very quiet, we never heard a sound from any of our neighbours. The staff are pleasant and helpful with any request. On the down side, there is no safe in the room, we were unable to get the air conditioning or the internet to work in our room. There are few TV channels and the one we were most interested in had intermittment signal interruption every 2 or 3 minutes during our entire stay. The subway station is right there which is very handy. The common room is not used and there is really no possibility of visiting with any of the other hotel guests. If you want an evening aperitif you will want to walk across the street to the Temple Bar. On balance, there was nothing seriously wrong with the hotel, but nothing particularly special to recommend it. I wouldn't object to staying here again but wouldn't make a point to seek it out. For the price, there are many options in Paris to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Jilloh
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Paris France Hotel recently for four nights. We found the hotel to be very convenient, extremely comfortable, and the staff helpful and friendly. Wouldn't hesitate to stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: tureluur
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a centrally situated, reasonably priced hotel, the Paris France is a good choice. This two-star hotel offers good accommodation, certainly not luxurious but remember you are not in Paris to stay in your hotelroom. Rooms are of standardsize, some rather small but not bad. In the bathroom no shampoo, a small piece of soap only. Every day towels were refreshed. The Rue Turbigo is noisy and has quite some traffic. This makes it not possible to sleep with open windows. Very nice and helpful staff at the front-desk. Breakfast typically French: simple. The Marais area is a very nice part of Paris, full of character and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Bare bones, but clean”
Reviews.Author: poindextermn
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a clean, bare-bones hotel, this would be a good choice. If your budget allows you to add some charm and comfort, however, look around. The rooms, including the bathroom, are tiny, and the only chair is a small desk chair; however, the small rooms are spotlessly clean. The hotel is near a metro stop, but you'll have to transfer at least once to get to any spot you're likely to want to visit. The neighborhood is a little iffy (noisy and not very clean), but you can find some decent restaurants if you walk three or four blocks. There are few amenities (no shampoo provided, hair dryer worked only intermittently), but there is free Wi-Fi, which may be more important than shampoo. The breakfast room was being remodeled, so breakfast (standard French fare of juice, coffee, bread, and croissant) was served in the basement--a little overpriced, but of pretty good quality. The staff was helpful. Not a hotel one can rave about, but neither is it necessary to warn people to stay away from it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: leebee73
Reviews.Content: Great location with small but clean room. Walking distance to many of the sights and very close to metro stations. We had two rooms, one for the kids one for us, the kids had a good sized bathroom, ours was a little bigger than a cupboard. Our only real gripe was that our room window was left wide open after being cleaned, we spoke to the front desk and we were assured that this wouldn't happen again, two days later came back after being out all day to find out window wide open again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: little_sares
Reviews.Content: My now-husband and I stayed here a few years ago, when we were first dating and living in London together. The hotel came recommended from my mother's friend, who lives in Paris part of the year. On our trip, we stayed here for 9 days, which is clearly not long enough in Paris... :) This was the best value for money we found throughout our travels through the UK, France and Italy. Hotel Paris France is located near Place de Republique which is a lovely area. There were wonderful shops, bakeries and coffee shops everywhere. It felt extremely safe and we enjoyed wandering the streets both day and night. The metro was a quick walk from the hotel, and from there the possibilities are endless. Our room was small but clean, and we had a lovely view out our window of the Eiffel Tower in the distance (amazing at night with the window wide open). It was nothing fancy, but we were there to experience Paris, not hang out in the room, so the hotel met all our needs. I would definitely request a top floor room so you can enjoy the view as well. The front desk people were all very friendly, and offered directions as needed, and also kept our bags at the front desk all day when we were departing. Overall, you cannot beat the location, price, cute rooms, and service this hotel provides. Even though we were young(er) and poor(er) when we originally stayed there, we'll probably be back next time we're in France!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: annie5309
Reviews.Content: My husband and I really liked this hotel b/c it wasn't "touristy" - we were in a part of town that seemed like we were living in the center of Paris. You could walk to many places and the metro was just down the street. We loved it here!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel on great location!”
Reviews.Author: tili01
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for a weekend (2 nights), a location was amazing you could walk everywhere and also there is a metro station just a minute from the hotel. Room is small but clean and the bathroom is great. Staff was very helpful would defiantly stay there again.. love that little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, charming staff”
Reviews.Author: KayCeeUk
Reviews.Content: Had a room facing the street in early December. It was snowing. The view across the Paris rooftops was simply fantastic, especially in the evening when the street lights were on. The hotel staff was lovely and helpful. Always smiling. Conveniently located just steps away from Temple metro station. Glass lift was cool! Will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a very good location!”
Reviews.Author: Springercrazy
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews on trip advisor and booked based on the reviews! I was not disappointed. The hotel staff was so friendly and helpful. The room was bigger than I expected and the beds were extremely comfortable. The breakfast is not huge croissants, coffee and bread, but it was in nice room downstairs and the coffee was very good! I was glad to not eat a giant breakfast and my 4 year old loved the bread and the chocolat (hot chocolate?)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: mockmoon
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Paris France Hotel for 3 nights in late September. I would have to say that this was my favourite accomodation of our 5 week holiday. The lobby of the hotel had a great charm and we were very impressed to find our room (56) had a perfect leafy outlook, right next to a church and with a view of the Eiffel Tower in the distance. It made for great viewing from one of the two balconies (one of the bedroom and one of the bathroom) Our bed were comfortable with no problems with noise at night. The bathroom was adequate but there was little room to put all our toiletries. We had breakfast on the first morning which was overpriced. I would definintely suggest going to one of the local cafes. Several convenience stores were in walking distance as was the subway although we walked to most of the time.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: maremar
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, very close to 2 subway stations, with a friendly staff and very cleany rooms (rooms are cleaning everyday). We stayed at a triple room, wich was big and confortable. They have free high speedy internet at the ground floor and at your room, too. Very good. There's some noisy when people walk because the hotel is in an old building, but this is a minor problem, since the hotel has a very high relation quality x price. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “relaxing and friendly”
Reviews.Author: suty5864
Reviews.Content: I would have to say we had a lovely stay at this hotel, the rooms were cleaned everyday and was in a great location for getting around Paris most could be done on foot from the hotel. Only one bureau de change about 15 minute walk away , but we explored the littlestreets on our mission to find it. Lots of places to eat just outside the hotel. Tv only has about 3 english stations but then again we were out nearly all the time. Breakfast croissants and toast with a drink if you have to pay extra dont go out for breakfast. Rooms where beautiful clean light and airy we were in the triple on the 1st floor on the side looking at the old church lovely and quiet. At about 7am you can hear the metro rumbling into life but not to a level that it annoys you. All in all We would stay there again and would recommend to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and access!”
Reviews.Author: TonyMnUK
Reviews.Content: We've been to Paris before and decided to give the Marais a go for our hotel. This place is in a great location with Temple Metro stop right at the door step and only 10 minutes from Gare du Nord station. The staff is very helpful with information and our room #86 was adequate. We did have a great view over the roof tops to Sacre Couer. We didn't bother with breakfast as we were next to several cafes and Monoprix, across the street, where you could run in and get wonderful pastries. Be sure to bring your own bath gels and scrubby, they don't have anything like this.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: newy0rkcitygirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Paris France hotel in April and was completely satisfied with everything - rooms were very clean, we had a triple room with a balcony overlooking a church. And on a clear day we were even able to see the Eiffel Tower in the distance, very cool. The woman at the reception desk, Christelle, was amazing! Very helpful with directions, and especially helpful after our flight back to New York was cancelled due to the volcano eruption in Iceland. We were stranded for an extra 5 days before we could fly out, tough life right ;) ... Christelle was very helpful in securing our room for the extra 4 nights we stayed. The bathroom was spotless, always had fresh towels...the only annoyance was that you had to hold the shower head because it was hand-held. But other than that no complaints. The free wi-fi was a life saver, and it was password protected so you didn't feel nervous about an unsecure connection. A few weeks before my trip, I emailed the hotel asking if we could have a room with a balcony and a nice view, and they completely delivered my request. I had read other reviews about certain rooms having balconies, so I wanted to make sure we got one. Overall, this is a great hotel if you're on a budget because the accomodations are perfect for what we needed - a clean, safe place to sleep since we would be sightseeing and taking in the city all day and night! Also, traveling as a group of three 22 year old girls, safety was a major priority and we felt extremely safe there. The hotel is small enought that the staff knows your face after a day or two, they would only let you past the lobby if they recognized you which we loved.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value, friendly staff, good beds”
Reviews.Author: foodieMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Spotlessly clean hotel with very helpful, English speaking staff. Located just one minute from Temple metro or about 3 mins from Republique, which is a main station easy to get to anywhere. Walkable to Notre Dame and Louvre in 20 minutes, close to some good restaurants too. Pramil is a small french restaurant 2 mins away that is supposed to be excellent. Book ahead as it was full both nights we were there. We ate at Le Florimond on the other side of town, details on tripadvisor - it was excellent. I would stay at this hotel again. All good, the only downfall was that it is quite noisy with traffic so you could not sleep with the window open. The windows are double glazed so it's not too bad, just something to be aware of if a light sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, good location for the price.”
Reviews.Author: L_Sutton
Reviews.Content: Room was small but this is Paris. We found the staff to be respectful, polite and helpful, not sure about other reviewers stating the opposite -- must have gotten a burr under their saddle somehow or else they were rude themselves and were repaid in kind. Yes the breakfast is 6 or 7 Euros for coffee, OJ and croissaints/bread, but you will pay more for all that just about anywhere else, and you won't get any refills elsewhere like you do here. This hotel does have perhaps the smallest elevator I've ever seen. One person with luggage at a time is the max, and even then it's a tight fit. Also there is a lot of street noise at this hotel, mostly cars and some idiot American yelling at the top of his lungs at midnight while we were there. With the window closed the noise was much less, but if it's hot you'll want the window open, as the air condiitioning controls are indecipherable (at least they were for me). Staff kept the room clean and everything worked. Good value for the money, but don't expect the Ritz. Very short walk to the Marais and nearby Republique metro station is a hub.

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Choice”
Reviews.Author: sheluvsblu
Reviews.Content: This place fell squarely within our budget and was a decent place to rest our head for a few days. Itâ€™s close to 2 metro lines (Republic and Temple ) which will get you anywhere in central Paris in a short amount of time. There are many cafes and boulangeries nearby in either direction and a 15 min walk (or less) will land you in the Marais. The staff was friendly and helpful and we received a warm check-in upon arrival. They speak just enough English to make contact easy if you have simple questions/requests. The room was small, clean and efficient. No frills or amenities but at the price we paid, none were expected. Our room faced the street (loved our view) and we were pleased by the lack of traffic noise thanks to the double-paned windows. On the downside, using a handheld shower in a bathtub in really close quarters is awkward, particularly when trying to prevent the water from splashing everywhere since there are no shower curtains. We forgot to request a shower stall but this did not hamper our stay and only took getting used to. But I have to admit that the breakfast was disappointing with a glass of OJ, coffee, and 2 croissants costing 6 euro pp. Overall, the hotel was clean, inexpensive and convenient with a friendly staff. I recommend it for budget travelers who plan to spend most of their time out and about enjoying Paris .

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: debbo_64
Reviews.Content: The Paris France Hotel is well placed for all attractions with a lovely church to the side of it. The rooms are fine for a few nights in Paris. Towels changed and room cleaned every day. I would recommend this hotel, the hotel is small and friendly and staff are very nice too, can't really say anything bad about it. I will stay here again when I visit Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: MichealK
Reviews.Content: We booked a superior double room online at â‚¬119 per night for four nights, but would have been happy with a smaller room. Our room had an extra bed that served as a platform for our luggage and clothing. The room had a wall cabinet for hanging clothes, but did not have any drawers for other clothing. The location is convenient to the metro stations and made our rail travel from Germany easy. We did not eat breakfast in the hotel (â‚¬6 per person), but chose to eat at the local bistros each morning. Our room faced the rue de Turbigo, which has nearly non-stop traffic; however, the new windows did a good job of blocking most of the noise. The room has AC, but we did not need it. The bathroom is compact, but has a large tub. The shower is a typical European design, which means you must hold the shower head while you bathe. This was not an issue for us since we have a similar design in our house. The only negative comment I can think of is the elevator was out of service for our floor. We had to take it to the floor above or below and take the stairs to our floor. The elevator is small because it fits in the center of a spiral staircase that services seven floors. Although it is load rated for three people, two adults or one adult with luggage will be a close fit. When we checked in, the staff told us that the elevator would be fixed within a few hours, and we saw the technician working on it. However, it remained out of service for our floor for the duration of our trip. The staff was friendly and helpful with directions to restaurants, stores, and points of interest. I would not hesitate to stay in this hotel for our next visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Budget Choice in Paris”
Reviews.Author: warehousestyle
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in April 2010. This is a great 'no frills' hotel, in a good location. Perfect base to explore Paris. Walking distance to the heart of Paris, with a number of metro train stations withing minutes from the hotel. Close to the funky Marais district, and a short walk to restarants and bars. Rooms are quite basic, but clean and comfortable - it's not like you spend much time in your room when in Paris. Good size for Paris standards, and value for money. No food available at hotel, except for light breakfast, but in Paris you don't want to sit at hotel anyway. A good choice for the budget traveller. Would definitely stay again when in Paris. Lift to all floors and free wifi internet a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough for a short trip to Paris”
Reviews.Author: GlasgowGirl50
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for 2 nights. We had only been to Paris for a day before and were looking forward to exploring it more. The room was fine, nice and clean, but not very big. As we were only there for a short time and didn't spend much time in it, this was fine but perhaps would be more of an issue if you had big suitcases and things are there was not a lot of storage. The bathroom was small but very clean and had a good shower. The staff were nice, spoke English and were friendly. The only thing lacking in this hotel was information. It would have been nice to have a folder in the room with basic information ( breakfast times, check-out, how to contact reception, how to connect to the internet etc. )

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: HeretoforeWilde
Reviews.Content: The Paris France Hotel was a good value for the money (about 80 Euros) a night. We had one large bed, a small but clean bathroom, cable TV, and free internet. The only problems were that the hotel didn't include shampoo and the noise from the street was a bit loud. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The first room we checked into smelled like smoke, but they quickly found us a fresher-smelling room. I'd recommend it. I actually spent a summer in a small apartment right down the street from the hotel, and this is one of my favorite neighborhoods in Paris. Several great restaurants are just down the street on rue du Vertbois and there are great bus connections nearby as well as the subway right next door.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: enelym1978
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for New Years Eve, for 4 nights. Paid around â‚¬80 per night for a double room with 2 double beds on the 6th floor. The location is perfect, 5min walk from Place de la RÃ©publique and almost next to metro station "Temple" so you have enough lines to go to the main attractions in Paris. Very very small elevator, as usual in this kind of buildings. The rooms are of a good size for Paris. I usually get those tiny rooms. This one was big enough, it was clean, a small desk, a closet and a bathroom. It was a corner room with a view on the neighboring church. No noise at all, only some light noise from the room next door. One negative point is the bathroom. It's a bath tub and there is no shower curtain. Means you end up with a flooded floor.... not that sexy. And the bathroom was a bit cold, it did not have it's own heater. Just had to keep the door open during the day so that the warmth of the room would mix with the bathroom. Not a big problem for me but for some, it might. I would stay there again if I can get the same rate. I attached two pictures with the review for a better idea.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, friendly staff & good location.”
Reviews.Author: Arizonabliss
Reviews.Content: I took Trip Advisors recommendation & booked this hotel. Everything that was said was true. This hotel was completely remodeled in 2009. The rooms are small, but functional, very clean & the beds & pillows extremely comfortable. The staff was very nice & helpful. The nearest metro (Temple) is about 1/2 block away. The Republique metro is about 2 blocks at most. I would skip the breakfast & head to the cafe around the corner where you will spend 1/2 & have a better pastry & coffee. I have been visiting Paris for over 30 years & recommend this hotel for value, too.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: jappert
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my girlfriend for 4 night from the 25th till the 29th of september 2009. Booked this Hotel based on the reviews on this site and was not dissapointed. Great location, rooms were clean and quite big for Paris Hotels, friendly staff I speak French though but they certainly also speak English. Things I didnt like....not much only that the walls are paperthin and if you open the window its indeed verry noisy and they could do a bit better in the shower, its not easy washing while holding the shower in one hand :)

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel, horribly rude city”
Reviews.Author: elsIowa
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great. The only problem was when they refused to telephone the police when I was hit by a taxi. Otherwise our 3 rooms and 8 people were pleased with the location and helpful staff. Paris itself was dirty and the people were rude for the most part. After being hit by a taxi going the wrong way on a one-way street (he took off), the hotel called a doctor who came to the hotel then charged 40 euros more than he quoted on the phone and he did not even check me over for injuries! Of all the major cities I have been to in the world, Paris is the one I wish I had not bothered with.

Reviews.Title: “We Would Definitely Come Back”
Reviews.Author: Canuckteacher72
Reviews.Content: After reading several favourable reviews, my then fiance and I decided to book the Hotel Paris France for our honeymoon stay. The hotel was well-situated, close to the Republique metro station, and a 20-minute walk from the Seine. The room we ended up with (76) had a beautiful back view of the adjacent church, and we could even see the Eiffel Tower in the distance. As well, it was very clean, and had a surprisingly modern bathroom. Although the room was not large, the bed was very comfortable and the a/c worked well. The staff were pleasant and helpful, and spoke good English. Lastly, we got a great summer deal (96 euros a night for a "superior double room") - good value for Paris. Do not hesitate to book here!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic accommodation in central paris”
Reviews.Author: jesssica-s-90
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for four nights late July, 2009 at a special rate of 79 euros a night- extremely cheap for Paris at this time of year. We were pleasantly surprised by the exterior of the hotel, very quaint on a lovely bustling parisian street. The conceierge was very helpful and spoke perfect English to us, gave us the key to the room and a few additional maps and information about the area. We stayed on the eighth floor; as the elavator only goes up to the seventh you then need to walk up a small staircase to get to the eighth. Our room was the best we had experienced on our whole Europe trip, looks just like the pictures from the website; modern, immaculate, bright, spacious. The best part- our spectacular view over all of the Paris rooftops and chimneys as well as the Sacre Coeur in the distance (which looks amazing all light up at night) and the Eiffel Tower to the far, far left. The location was perfect, only a two minute walk to Republique metro station which will take you directly to the centre of Paris. We walked to the Tuileries a few times, only took us maybe twenty minutes. To walk to Ile Saint Louis- Left Bank (the best of the islands, in my opinion) is about twenty-five minutes, very direct and beautiful walk. We also regularly walked to the Marais, the centre is about ten-fifteen minute walk, would definetely recommend eating/drinking here (especially Jewish district!) as it is far better quality and less touristy than the Republique (where the hotel is situated). It's a safe walk at night too because you just follow Rue De Turbigo which is a very busy street. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone, try to request a room on one of the top floors facing Rue De Turbigo (if you don't mind the noise!) Would pay any amount of money for that view again!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing wrong with this one.”
Reviews.Author: OutOfTownersplus1
Reviews.Content: I meant to post this after our visit last august, better late than never. We booked a room at this hotel over the phone, same day, from Gare D'Austerlitz after cutting short our stay in southern France. Expectations were low, as I picked this out of Time Out Paris guide blindly, we just wanted to be in Marais-ish neighborhood. Surprise. the location was good, the rate was good, the room was ready for us upon arrival, the bathroom large and the cleanest we've seen at these rates in Paris. Rue du Temple metro stop is practically at the doorstep. Monoprix around the corner, comes in handy when you have an always hungry/thirsty 10 yr old traveling with you. Lobby is clean and spacious. The front desk staff was friendly, efficient, forthcoming with advice/info when asked. we will return to this hotel if the economy every gives us a chance to travel again!

Reviews.Title: “It's all in the fine print”
Reviews.Author: lizag09
Reviews.Content: A friend and I decided to stay here for our last 2 days in Paris. When they say that it's by the Louvre, they mean that it's in the same city. If you were walking from the Louvre (like we did with our luggage) then it's about 30-40 minutes. The free internet is only free if you have a laptop with wireless card and even then it cuts in and out. The shuttle service to the airport costs 17 Euros a person and you have to book it a few days in advance to secure a time. Breakfast costs 7 Euros each day, they only told us this when we asked. Being by the Republique was nice, even if that wasn't where we thought we'd be. The TV did have several English channels for those nights you are dead tired. Only about half the staff speaks English. It is quaint to look at. But our bathroom door didn't close. Nor did we have a shower curtain. This made showering an adventure. Overall it was below what we thought we were booking. Such is life I guess

Reviews.Title: “clean cute & well located”
Reviews.Author: ViajanteBrasileir0
Reviews.Content: It is newly renovated but with the beauty of the past . Very good / fair deal for the money . Close to 3 metro lines and many taxi / buses . We were few friends from Brazil and enjoyed our stay there . The view of the Church next door and the city of paris is charming . Muito bom amigos ! recomendado !

Reviews.Title: “clean, classy and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Travaleen
Reviews.Content: we loved the location-- close to the pompidou and the marais. we were bummed to find out our double bed was two twins pushed together (not so romantic!), but it was clean, classy and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “weekend away”
Reviews.Author: patlimerick
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a weekend.It is a basic clean hotel.The staff were nice and friendly.The hotel is in a good location close to restaurants and bars. The hotel is about 2mins away from metro station temple on line no:3 heading towards gallieni.The hotel room we were stayed in had no shower only a bath and showerhead .The breakfast in the hotel is basic and it cost â‚¬6{croissant and coffee}.A good breakfast is available in Mc Donalds close by.It was very cold in paris we would recomend warm cloths be worn at this time of the year.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for exploring Paris”
Reviews.Author: BumbleBee023
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from spending two nights at this hotel for new year. The hotel was lovely and although breakfast was basic (croissant & coffee) it was more than adequate. If you're not too keen on croissants there is a monoprix just around the corner which sells an array of pastries. The hotel is a 1 min walk from Republique metro station from which you can explore the sights of Paris. The hotel is very easy to access from Charles de Gualle airport, just follow the signs for RER B. You can but tickets for this at the station but the ticket machines only accept coins not notes. However, there are some change machines dotted around the station. From here you need to get the train to Gare du Nord and then take the orange metro line to Republique. Again the metro ticket machines only accept coins. We found it easier to buy a book of 10 tickets each which works out cheaper (about 11 euros) and is less hassle. The 10 tickets lasted us for our 3 days there. The staff at the hotel are very lovely and friendly. Alhtough the lift is tiny two of us did manage to fit in it with one suitcase and one bag.There are lots of cafes and restaurants around the hotel so there are plenty of places to eat. We booked 'Cafe Serafin' for NYE and although the 5 course meal cost us 160 euros with wine it was the best meal I have ever had. We had pre-booked the restaurant online before we went with it being NYE. I believe that a standard meal there is about 24 euros each which is pretty cheap for Paris. Its literally a 5 minute walk from the hotel and is very cool and trendy. They also do amazing cocktails there. In the three days there we manage to visit all of the standrad tourist sights without queuing too long. The longest we queued for was an hour and an half was to ice skate at the Hotel du Ville. The queue for the Louvre appears a lot longer than it is as you have to initially queue for bag checking, once past this its not too bad. The Mona Lisa is certainly worth a visit. We were suprised that the Pompediou Centre was open on New Years Day and this was a great way to spend our last day alomg with a visit to the Sacre Coeur. New Years Eve on the Champs Elysee was not as impressive as I thought it would've been as there weren't many fireworks but you have to go there for the atmosphere. The metros were hell on new years eve howver they are free. It was freezing in Paris and I would recommend taking lots of layers and confortable walking shoes. However, we were lucky enough for it to snow which made up for being so cold.I would certainly recommend spending New Years in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Massimo1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just 100 meters from the Republique metro station and just 15 minutes walk to the Seine, the Marais, Les Halles, and the Bastille areas. It is in a lively area with cafes and shops. I booked a double room at the last minute and was fortunate to get room 16 on the first floor. The room was actually a triple, with two twin beds pushed together plus a single rollaway in another corner of the room. It sounds odd, but the room was larger than the typically small double rooms with cramped bathrooms and shower cabinet offered at this hotel. Room 16 has a full size bathroom with a tub/shower. The room iss on the side of the hotel, facing the side of St. Elizabeth's church across the alley. Every so often the lovely bells ring, which I liked. The bed (a single bed) was firm and comfortable, the room had a 32" flat screen LCD TV, and the fabric covering the walls was a nice touch. If you stay at this hotel, ask for something on the first floor and you will have wonderful old floor-to-ceiling arched windows. Yes, it is closer to the street, but the windows in the hotel are double-glazed, so the traffic noise is quite reduced. If you listen, you can hear the rumble of the metro going under the street by the building every few minutes (not really disturbing). And yes, this hotel does have the smallest lift in Europe. Literally big enough for only 1 full-sized adult plus small suitcase. The downsides to this hotel are: you can hear the people walking in the room above you, and at this time they don't provide shampoo and shower gel - which most hotels in this price category do.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed, but would definitely book again !!!”
Reviews.Author: firsttimeinparis
Reviews.Content: Quite to the contrary I found this hotel very clean. The problem I encountered was with one of the front desk person that almost ruined my stay for the first time in paris. I knew about this hotel from a friend who's sister stayed here and recommended it to him. I was unable to book this hotel from Canada due to various circumstances. However fate had it that upon exploring the neighborhood that I had already booked, I would be walking by this hotel. So I spoke to the man @ front desk on Sunday which was my second day in Paris, he told me that he would have a room available the upcoming Wednesday till the following Sunday of my departure, took all the info and wrote down my name in his book. He also said that I should give a two day prior notice to my current hotel so I could be free of any obligations from them. Now the Tuesday prior I wanted to confirm things, but this is where the nightmare started. The new person @ front desk totally shocked me by asking me for a receipt, something that I should've asked for on the Sunday when I booked for Wednesday! Combining his incompetence and no record of the transaction by me I was about to be living on the streets of Paris. The new guy told me to come back Wednesday and speak to the man whom I originally spoke to on Sunday and I did, but again another surprise as there was a beautiful girl @ front desk and the same argument ensued, but she was quick enough to check all the books and found my info. and told me to bring over my stuff and leave them in the lobby until the room be ready. The room given was the size of a closet but immaculately renovated, however they should've changed the bed covers as they were quite old. The staff were very helpful and courteous and when ever I couldn't explain in French they would in English. The cleaning staff were superb as well and two times I left them one euro for their good service. The flat screen 19" monitor is great with all the fantastic channels from various European countries. The Cafe across the street called "Favorite" has the cheapest coffee, and the "Mono-Prix" just around the corner has the best "croissant almond" and cheap. The metro which is line 3 "Temple" is a MINUTE walk from the hotel no exaggeration!!!!! I would definitely stay here again but will make sure about the booking. The view from room could see the top of the Eiffel, and all the beautiful buildings surrounding it. I was lucky that my neighbors were mature and had awesome sleeps at anytime. Also you don't have to hold the shower head with one hand as I know many of you are bothered by it !!! Bon Voyage

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Nala29
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Paris France hotel for 5 nights. It has just been newly refurbished and the rooms are excellent. We were a party of 7 and had 3 rooms between us, all were large with large bathrooms and a lovely view. The decor in the rooms is lovely and new. The staff at the hotel are also excellent, very helpful with all our questions. The hotel is also in a great spot, close to 2 metro stops. Between the 2 stops you can get anywhere without changing trains too much. Would highly recommend and will definetly stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: Oljyee
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Virginia Hotel in August. Family of 4 - with 2 kids around age 10. We had a family room (2 connected rooms). I'm very happy with the hotel, everyone was very friendly, rooms were clean, parking is very close to the hotel and safe as well. The continental breakfast was very good. I can't say anything bad about that place. Moreover, the surroundings are very handy as well - close to the metro, bus and tramp station! Very convenient. Even the taxi from the Eiffel Tower to the hotel was in a very reasonable price. I recommend it to all the future guests. And for sure I will be staying in this hotel next time I visit Paris. Best regards, - O.Kolmasiak

Reviews.Title: “Virginia family first trip to Paris”
Reviews.Author: sid205
Reviews.Content: Our family (myself, my wife and daughters 15 &19) stayed there in June 2008. The staff were great and the the Family ensuite room suited us well. This was a great place to stay for a first trip to Paris. All the typical things you want to see are within a short Metro ride away. A nice plus was there was a Monoprix on the next block and a non touristy little great place for breakfast nearby. Also there is a Chocolate shop/restaurant nearby that has great pastries where we ate breakfast one morning and had to go back for more chocolate. This is not a luxury hotel. The elevator is small , only room for 2 people. But if your not physically challenged by walking a floor or two to your room and want a good place to stay at a reasonable price i would recommend this hotel. Close to Metro and both Gare D'Nord and Est

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Paris France re-visited”
Reviews.Author: JerryO'R
Reviews.Content: First stayed here in July 2006 and our review of that experience hasn't changed; in fact somewhat better this time. The room we had had recently been refurbished and bathroom was sufficiently large with bath and shower above. Room cleaned and towels changed daily. Staff again very helpful and polite. This hotel is extremely well situated with some nice bars relatively close by. Happy hour at 'Art et Metiers' 6pm until 9pm (very prompt cut off!!) but nice premises and cheerful waiters.
