Would not hesitate to stay at Hotel Paris France again. However, I wish they would provide coffee and tea facilities in room, but they are no different from a lot of European hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Quaint, Friendly and great price!”
Reviews.Author: bgsantander
Reviews.Content: We had originally reserved at another hotel on the Rue de Turbigo. When we arrived at our original hotel it was absolutely HORRIBLE (Hotel Bellevue Chariot D'Or)! We immediately set out on foot and were fortunate enough to find the Hotel Paris France on the same street and it had availability. It was very charming, clean, and well appointed. The lobby entrance has some beautiful mosaic tile work and the lounge area was comfortable with large leather couches and a bar. It was actually much more than we expected for the price. The view from our room was beautiful and the staff was very, very friendly and helpful. I would recommed this hotel to anyone looking for accomodations in this price range. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great staff, Great experience”
Reviews.Author: TravelinDD
Reviews.Content: This hotel came recommended by a friend as a relatively cheap, no frills hotel that was in a good location (ie near metro and safe part of paris), for a good price with English speaking staff. It lived up to the recommendation. The rooms and bathrooms are small and the bed was less than supportive (and like most of Europe the pillows were thin), however, we didn't go to Paris to hang out in our hotel. The hotel is in a lovely spot with a great grocery store around the corner, coffee shops line the streets around it and it is barely 5 mins walk to several metro stops. The staff was great. They gave us a recommendation to a traditional french restaurant and it was one of the best restaurant experiences of my life. (it was tucked down an alley (walking distance to the hotel), the owner was the chef and his wife the waitress, it was small and intimate with lots of old french ambiance and the food to die for - sorry I don't remember the name). The room itself was clean as was the bathroom - lots of hot water. We also had access to internet for a small fee (although it was pretty slow). Apparently the hotel also serves breakfast for a small fee, but I'd recommend skipping that and enjoying something fresh from the surrounding cafes.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jelly30
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews of this hotel and various others I was not expecting much and was therefore very pleased with what we got. The staff were very friendly and helpful, room was a decent size and clean. My husband had booked through the hotel's website and found it easy enough to do. Confirmation came through promptly and they were very helpful over email in the time before we travelled. They were very happy to accommodate our early arrival and even had our room ready for when we arrived at around 10am. Excellent shower over the bath, although the bathroom itself was quite small but comfortable enough for what you need to do in it. Location was great, 10min walk to Pompidou Centre and bars, cafe's. Very close to the metro. All in all a very good choice and I would stay there again with no hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, tiny rooms, awful bathroom”
Reviews.Author: nonameSn
Reviews.Content: The main advantage of the hotel is the location: barely some 15 minutes walk from the Louvre. Rooms are ok but tiny; the bathrooms are even smaller and rather unpleasant. The hotel is near the Republique metro lines, so it has an easy access to most parts of the city. It doesn`t include breakfast. Overall it's ok, though there must be better options around...

Reviews.Title: “Okay for 3 Nights”
Reviews.Author: mollyandme
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here with our 9 & 11 year old daughters. It was tight but served the purpose. We never got the TV working which was fine. It was clean and the beds were comfortable. The location was pretty good being near 3 different metro stops. There was a nice bakery close by that my 9 year old and I enjoyed every morning and a grocery store behind the hotel.. Also, near the Repulique was a creperie. The walls are pretty thin and one night our neighbors woke us but they settled down shortly after. The staff was very nice and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: ronnicsp
Reviews.Content: This hotel is inexpensive, has a perfect location, a great personal and the rooms have a reasonable size and are nice and clean. Sorry i don't have picture from the room but check out their homepage.

Reviews.Title: “Great ..Great Deal!!”
Reviews.Author: americaninrome
Reviews.Content: Great location. Close to everything and wonderfully clean. Rooms big for a 2 star and comfortable too!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and well-cleaned hotel”
Reviews.Author: neciolina
Reviews.Content: The room was quite big and very very clean. The only flaw had been the small bed (I think it was a French double bed, so more little than I expected). But for rest I can only recommend this hotel..and the panorama from "my" 8th floor was beautiful (You can see the tip of Tour Eiffel that at night is all enlightened!!!). The staff was always affable and very kind. ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Rocky start, but good finish”
Reviews.Author: Tessuti
Reviews.Content: When I first arrived I was disappointed with the size of the room. I had booked a single so it was my error. I should have booked a double for one person. The breakfast was also disappointing- the coffee was somewhat oily and the croissants did not have that wonderful richess one expects. After two days I gave up on the hotel breakfast and went across the street to La Favourite and had breakfast at the bar with better coffee and croissants for less â‚¬ than the hotel. The main complaint is the TV. They still have not fixed the satellite, so you had better get used to very few channels, all in french. But the location is great. Easy to get to some of the nicest bits of Paris- the Marais, Etienne Marcel, Place Victoire, Place des Vosges. If you walk down Rue de Turbigo until Rue Tiquetonne and turn onto that street , there are some great little bistros and also on Rue Montorgueil. Your stomach will be most happy. The hotel managed to botch up my booking for the shuttle to the Airport- I requested it, but they forgot to confirm it. The staff all in all though is pretty competent. I will stay there again, using the knowlege I picked up from this visit. I am not going for the hotel, I am going for Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Foxycleo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my husband and it is our second time in Paris. Before going there I asked via email for a Quiet room with AC and internet. I then finalized the booking on the phone and ask to be in a quiet room not facing the street. She told us we could be on the 5th or 7th floor on the "garden" side (which is really the roof of a next by church). I was also told that they are installing AC but should not be ready for us but that the rooms have fans. We got a room facing the street so noisy, no AC (I think they lied about "installing it") nor a fan (we asked for one and they put one after the first night) and on the 2nd floor (but at our request they changed us for the 7th). For the WiFi internet it is 10 euros for 24 hours but you can probably find a signal from elsewhere at no charge from your room. Other than the fact that we didn't get what we asked for, the room and the bathroom was clean and big (for Paris). We had room #72 (I think all the rooms ending with 0,1,2,3 are facing the streets) which has a double bed + a single bed and dark blue walls and a window facing Turbigo street which is a one way 2 lane street. It gets quieter at night but the motorcycles are very noisy i nthe morning and with the window open for air, it is sometimes hard to sleep well. Last time we came here we stayed in the 6e arrondissement which is more lively and closer to attractions but much more touristy. Hotel Paris France has nice little streets around it with little cafÃ©s like Vieille Temple which is authentic. You can also find supermarket, pharmacy in the area. Overall, if we would have got the room that we expected, we would have rated it "Above average" instead of "Average". If you are looking for a relatively quiet room (you still can here the streets a bit even on the "garden" side), make to ask for a room that is NOT on the street itself and higher up (6 or 7th floor).

Reviews.Title: “Great deal”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It's my third time in Paris France Hotel. It's is the best deal in Paris for the money it's a 2* hotel and feels like 3*. The rooms are clean and spacious, The guys at front desk are very friendly and helpful. The location very convenience, the metro is less than a block away, and basically it's a walking distance from all the attractions. You also have some brasseries around and big inexpensive supermarket across the street. I'll stay there again at my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Clean quality at a budget price”
Reviews.Author: merrittm
Reviews.Content: Hotel Paris France on 72 rue de Turbigo, 75003, Paris. Located on the edge of the Marais near the Republique and Temple metro stops, this is a good budget hotel with a diverse clientele. We were a french class and took all the single rooms. The website shows their best rooms, so ours did not look like the brochures, but all our rooms and some others I saw were all squeeky clean, although a bit worn. The staff is helpful and friendly in a reserved way. The breakfast room is in the basement and has the usual continental breakfast with LOTS of coffee available - good for those who don't want one tiny cup for breakfast. The close proximity to several metro stops made it very easy to get around. All in all, an excellent experience for the budget traveler.

HotelInfo.Name: Paris France Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 72 rue Turbigo, 75003 Paris, France
